strapiPost.title: Natural State Criterium Series Returns To Downtown Springdale
strapiPost.content:
Downtown Springdale will host the first of three Natural State Criterium Series events on Wednesday, May 31, from 4:30-8p with riders competing for up to $4,000 in prizes.

  • Join the fun: Each race will begin with the First Chance Criterium clinic, where new riders will receive professional coaching, followed by a women's race, three categories of difficulty, and a Fat Tire Fun Race. Riders can register for one race or the Overall Series, including May 31, Jun 28, and Jul 26.
  • A natural spectacle: The high-energy, spectator-friendly race will begin and end at Shiloh Square and can be enjoyed from Downtown Springdale's Outdoor Dining District, where many businesses will stay open for the event. A Kids Zone will be open at Turnbow Park and Shiloh Square, hosted by Buddy Pegs, Pedal It Forward, Jones Center, and Arkansas Children's Northwest.

Find more information about the Natural State Criterium HERE.
